title: "Unused macro" lint still fires when a private macro 2.0 is used in a public macro 2.0

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=5a4cf00d0900820bf46f9759fc2c5f4d)):

```rust
#![feature(decl_macro)]

macro inner {
    () => {
        // private implementation
    }
}

pub macro public {
    () => {
        $crate::inner!()
    }
}

// ...more macros that use inner()...
```

I expected to see this happen: the code compiles with no errors or warnings.

Instead, this happened: the "unused macro definition" lint is tripped:
```
warning: unused macro definition
 --> src/lib.rs:3:1
  |
3 | / macro inner {
4 | |     () => {
5 | |         // private implementation...
6 | |     }
7 | | }
  | |_^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_macros)]` on by default
```

It appears that the lint is not satisfied unless there are uses of it in the same crate; in other words, using `public!` in another crate doesn't satisfy the lint.

### Meta
